metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.code_html:
public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    // Enable assertions
    ClassLoader loader = ClassLoader.getSystemClassLoader();
    loader.setDefaultAssertionStatus(true);
    
    // Run the assert example
    AssertExample example = new AssertExample();
    example.run();
  }
}

class AssertExample {
  public void run() {
    int a = 12;
    try {
      assert a == 12; // Assertion without a fail message
      assert a == 12 : "a is not 12";
      assert a == 15 : "a is not 15";
    } catch (AssertionError e) {
      System.out.println(e.getMessage());
    }
  }
}

content.text: The assert keyword evaluates a boolean expression and throws an AssertionError exception if the expression evaluates to false . When the exception is thrown we say that the assertion failed.
content.html: The assert keyword evaluates a boolean expression and throws an AssertionError exception if the expression evaluates to false. When the exception is thrown we say that the assertion failed.

content.text: An optional expression can be added which will be used as the exception message if the assertion fails.
content.html: An optional expression can be added which will be used as the exception message if the assertion fails.

content.text: Assertions are disabled by default. assert statements are ignored unless assertions are enabled.
content.html: Assertions are disabled by default. assert statements are ignored unless assertions are enabled.

content.text: The purpose of assertions is to clearly mark where a program is doing something unintended when debugging and testing a program.
content.html: The purpose of assertions is to clearly mark where a program is doing something unintended when debugging and testing a program.
